lines.text:
[Looking at Larry's new office]
All this joint needs is a horsehair sofa... and a horsehair sofa.

[to Dan]
It's rainin' soup, boy! Throw away your fork and get a spoon!

[to Larry]
Hey, look, you say this is on the up-and-up? Well, I don't want to spit in no cop's eye. If you're hooked up with this, there's some kind of gazype in it!
I got nothin' against sex. Either you got it, or you go lookin' for it.
Boy, this is something! It's colossal!
It's better than that. It's positively mediocre!

[about Don]
That guy could fall down a sewer and come up with a bottle of perfume in both hands!

[to Larry]
Nothing's worth ten thousand in cash, not even a million.

[to Larry]
You couldn't sell fresh fish to a starving seal.

[to Larry]
Do me a favor, will you? Go out and find a chiropodist and have your head examined.
There's more to a magazine than circulation!
Yes, and there's more to your blood than circulation, but try to do without it.

[Looking at the photographs of scantily-clad men Jean has given her]
Well, look who's fallen among us! Mmmm-mmm!
We're using these boys in an idea we're working on, outdoor sports with indoor trimmings.

[Laciviously]
As far as I'm concerned... outdoors, indoors, or behind doors!
Well, well, well, if it isn't the belle of the big house? You haven't changed a bit, Jean. Still the same swell number.
Lay off that number stuff. You'll never make a number out of me again.
Still the same quick comeback.
Yeah, and the same slick come-on. And speaking of come-on, about that oil deal...
Oh, forget it. That's last week's wash.
Maybe, but it hasn't been ironed out yet. Why didn't you tell me there was no oil in those oil wells?
I didn't know there was no oil in those oil wells.
But you knew there were no oil wells.
What's the most sought-after thing in the country today?
A medium-priced giraffe.
